description:
Job Number: 225022

Join Forbes' 2023 Best Employer for Diversity!

As a data scientist or senior on the Attribution and Innovation team, you’ll build creative asset testing, reporting, and attribution through data modeling and experimentation. Additionally, you’ll analyze unstructured text gathered from consumer research and provide sentiment and thematic analysis. You’ll oversee new creative and attribution effectiveness modeling, and partner with our media team and their data scientists to improve the impact of our advertising campaigns.

Remote work allowed.

Must-have qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or higher with quantitative focus in Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field (e.g. Mathematics).
• Instead of a degree, a minimum of three years of relevant experience in statistical/quantitative modeling and/or Machine Learning tools (R, Python, etc.) and in using various database tools (e.g. Hadoop, SQL) processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data.

Preferred skills
• Experience in media, analytics, or marketing including creative testing, measurement, and modeling
• Experience creating, building and managing attribution modeling via Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) and Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) or other methods
• Knowledge of marketing measurement approaches and the strengths or limitations each approach
• Understanding of marketing metrics throughout purchase funnel (awareness, consideration, impressions, click through rate, return on ad sales)
• Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Microsoft BI, and strong storytelling ability working with complex data sets and creating executive level summaries

Compensation
• $70,100 - $102,800/year depending on position level and experience
• Gainshare bonus up to 30% of your eligible earnings based on company performance

Benefits
• 401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to 6%
• Medical, dental & visionB, including free preventative care
• Wellness & mental health programs
• Health care flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, & life insurance
• Paid time off
• Paid & unpaid sick leave where applicable, as well as short & long-term disability
• Parental & family leave; military leave & pay
• Diverse, inclusive & welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups
• Career development & tuition assistance
• Onsite gym & healthcare at large locations

Energage recognizes Progressive as a 2023 Top Workplace for: Innovation, Purposes & Values, Work-Life Flexibility, Compensation & Benefits, and Leadership.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Sponsorship for work authorization for this position is available for candidates who already possess an H-1B- visa.

For ideas about how you might be able to protect yourself from job scams, visit our scam-awareness page at https://www.progressive.com/careers/how-we-hire/faq/job-scams/
